list.problem: Where do I get my code again if I've lost it?
list.fix: Use the instructions on the next slide.

list.problem: How do I know my code is being included?
list.fix: From within Chrome, check the end of the body of the html by right-clicking and selecting View Page Source. You should see the google analytics javascript code you pasted into googleAnalytics.handlebars at the bottom of </body>.

list.problem: My code is included but I'm still not seeing the collect message in the Network tab.
list.fix: A zealous Adblock sometimes blocks messages to google analytics. Try disabling your adblock plugin for the duration of this lab if you have one.

comment: Record an event whenever the user clicks a Like button on a project
title: Hint

list.problem: How do I register a user click?
list.fix: Check back to Lab 3 slide about how listening to clicks

list.problem: How do I add the Google Analytics event?
list.fix:
Remember back from slide 9-Store any kind of event on the form of 
ga("send", "event", <Category>, <Action>);
Substitute out <Category> for 'like', and <Action> for 'click' and place it in the click event handler.

list.problem: How do I clear my cookies so I can see an alternate version of the site?
list.fix: You can do this by going to google chrome's settings, Show Advanced Settings→Content settings→All Cookies and Site Data. From there, search your heroku URL and Remove the cookie, like below.

list.problem: This is a lot of work. Is there a better way?
list.fix: In fact, yes! You could simply open an incognito window and it won't save cookies.
